gadget.name: TriggerTIntro
gadget.gadget: Triggers are the brain of a scenario. The map and design make your map look nice,
but trigger make it run. Without triggers, you have a map and perhaps a few
handfuls of units. There is no way to actually win or be defeated without triggers.

gadget.name: TriggerBasics
gadget.gadget: This is the main trigger UI:
Conditions: View and edit conditions of the selected trigger.
Effects: View and edit effects of the selected trigger.
Alle Trigger kopieren: Copy all triggers
Alle Trigger laden: Paste all triggers (Warning: This will OVERWRITE all

gadget.name: TriggerBasics2
gadget.gadget: Press the "Insert" Button now and have a look at the trigger overview panel
It shows a general overview of the trigger and lets you change a few things
-- the name, its priority, and its rules (Active, Loop, and/or Run Immediately).
It also shows a list of all the conditions and effects.

gadget.name: TriggerBasics3
gadget.gadget: Let's have a look of what the buttons, boxes, and entry fields here do.
Active: Set a trigger to active, so it will run. Inactive triggers will not run unless active.
Loop: A looped trigger will run repeatedly.
Run Immediatelty: The Effect will immediate happen when the checked Condition is true
Priority: Set the triggers priority. Triggers with the highest priorty will run before triggers
that have lower priority. It has influence on how often the Condition is checked
HIGH: every few ms MEDIUM: ~4 secs LOW: 8secs - few minuites

gadget.name: Conditions1
gadget.gadget: Press the Button "Conditions" from the main trigger overview panel

gadget.name: Conditions2
gadget.gadget: Conditions are what causes the trigger to execute its effects. While an active trigger
starts at the beginning of the game, its effects will not be executed until its
In AOE3 you could say for any Trigger: If the CONDITION is TRUE do the trigger EFFECT

gadget.name: Conditions3
gadget.gadget: OR: if checked only ONE condition must be true to acivate the effect
NOT: Makes it so when conditions are not fufilled the effects are executed. NOT also
inverts the OR-button, so when OR is not checked if only one condition is not true,
then it will run. When OR is checked, all conditions must be not true.

gadget.name: Effects1
gadget.gadget: Press the Button "Effects" from the main trigger overview panel

gadget.name: Effects2
gadget.gadget: Effects are the meat of a trigger - they make it actually do something. The effects are
run when the conditions are fufilled. Effects of a trigger will only run once unless
it is looped. Note that effects run in the order that they are placed

gadget.name: Example1
gadget.gadget: 1. Insert a new trigger if you havent allready one
3. Go to the effect UI and Insert "Send Chat"
You'll notice two parameters, one is "From Player" the other is named "Message"
4. Select Player 1 for the parameter "From Player"
5. We fill now in as Message "Hello World"
7. Do some variation e.g. loop it, set it inactive, change the message/player,...

gadget.name: Example1Screenshots
gadget.gadget: In the editor (trigger is selected in the main trigger UI)

gadget.name: Example2
gadget.gadget: 1. Place a bunch of units around an enemy fort
2. Insert a new trigger if you havent allready one
3. Go to the condition UI and select "always" and change it to "Is Dead"
4. Go to the effect UI and Insert "Send Chat" and "Set Player Defeated"
5. For Send Chat use the Player1 and the Message "We beat Player2"
5. For Set Player defeated we select Player2

gadget.name: QV1
gadget.gadget: QV's are used to work with numbers. They act like variables and can do some math
Quest Var Set: Sets a QV. It overwrites anything that was already in the QV
Quest Var Modify: Modifies a QV by a number ("+" add,"-" substract ,"*" multiply,"/" divide)
Quest Var Modify 2: Modifies your first QV by your second QV. The resulting QV is your first one
Quest Var Randomize: Randomizes a QV-> It Sets a random Number between the given Numbers
[Condition] Quest Var Check: Checks a QV based on the given parameters.
Quest Var Copy: Copies one QV to another. The original is not affected.
Let's have some fun with QV'sgadgetReal("Example3") gadgetUnReal("QV1")

gadget.name: Example3
gadget.gadget: 1. Add a trigger and call it "Randomizer". Use as Condition "Always"
2. Set the effect "Quest Var Randomize" with the Parameters:
Var Name = QV1; Minimum = 1; Maximim = 2; Turn Rounding "ON"
3. Add a trigger and call it "Event". Use as Condition "Quest Var Check"
Parmeters: Var Name = QV1; Operator = "=="; Value = 1;
The Effect is "Send Chat" with the Message "Event1"
Now press the Copy Button from the Trigger Main UI
Change the Value of the Condition to 2 and the Message to "Event2" ->Playtest

gadget.name: Operator
gadget.gadget: Let's have a look at the different types operators
">" Greater (e.g. check if QV is Greater then 1)
">=" Greater or equal to (e.g. check if QV is Greater or equal to 1)
"==" equal to (e.g. Check Units in Area equal to 0)

gadget.name: Custom1
gadget.gadget: There are many files that are worth to download (from AOE3.heavengames.com)
1.Consti's Triggerpack (Including the Typeloader). All custom effects with the
ending *TL* requires the Typeloader. Heal Effects + SP Effects work just in Singleplayer
2. Advanced Trigger Set + M925 Triggerpack + gunner's Triggerpack
For Singleplayer only there is a mod that enables homecity buildings + effects +
units but it is for TAD 1.01

gadget.name: Custom2
gadget.gadget: For designers I can recommend these Sites
http://aoe3.heavengames.com/ (Forums + tons of maps to download)
